definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to conceal from/to keep (sb) in the dark

sentences.english: Never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决不撒谎，欺瞒或偷盗，坚守平允买卖。

sentences.english: How have you handled customers who take advantage of sales support staff?
sentences.chinese: 你如何对待那些起欺瞒销售辅助售人员的顾客？

sentences.english: Never lie,cheat or steal,always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决不撒谎，欺瞒或偷盗，坚守公平交易。

sentences.english: never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决没有说谎，欺瞒或偷窃，苦守平正生意业务。

sentences.english: He wish there are no more disputes in the earth, people should stop lieing, you don't know what that means.
sentences.chinese: 他希望这个地球不再纷争，人们不再欺瞒，你不相信。

sentences.english: It is a shame then that ignorance and conceit should be stronger than wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 那么无知和欺瞒竟然压倒智慧就是一种羞愧。

sentences.english: He wish there are no more disputes in the earth, people should stop lieing, you don't know what that.
sentences.chinese: 他希望这个地球不再纷争，人们不再欺瞒，你不信。

sentences.english: Because it is for want of this logical articulation that these slippages can be produced.
sentences.chinese: 因为缺乏这个逻辑的表达，才会产生这些欺瞒诡辩。

definition: to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to frame/to bring false charges against
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
